title: Cleaning while also parenting/working/surviving - advice needed!
self_text: So, I guess I'm not a "new" mum - LO is now 1 year old, I'm back at work part time, things feel normal and good and I'm happy with everything... except the state of the house.  I would really like to live in a cleaner, tidier house. I'm all for lowering my standards, but the standards are on the floor, along with the toys, the rubbish, the laundry. My partner does his fair share but works full time, often doing 8 day shift stretches, and when it comes to the weekend we want to enjoy it properly with our baby. We can't afford a cleaner (not even a once-a-month or one off clean, we tried that), but equally, saving any cleaning for when we have chance to do it properly means it takes up basically the whole day - it's boring, messy and the one whose doing it (and not taking the baby) resents the whole thing.  So my question is - what are the things we could be doing during the week (beyond the usual basic chores you can do quietly in the evenings when baby is in bed) that will cut down the 'big clean' time? Hacks, tiktok accounts, konmari - as parents, what  actually  works and helps make life easier and stops you living in slum conditions? Have you found anything that's been  revelation?  (Please don't say 'see past the mess' or anything like that - I genuinely do have low standards, but there comes a point where things do need to be cleaner and tidier than they are, because hygiene/safety + small baby)

title: DAE get told they talk too much?
self_text: I work at a small jewelry store. Recently, a few of my co workers asked me why I was being so quiet and that they were worried because usually I talk so much they want to tell me to shut up. So, naturally, I’m even more quiet. Who likes to be told that?? Literally no one.   Then one day, I have a bad day and I was talking a lot. I don’t like silence. I like to talk. I like getting to know things in general. At the end of the night, my store manager was laughing and said just to let you know, you talked too much tonight.   I know that they’re jokes, but they don’t feel like jokes. I also know that I’m not going to actually tell them how I feel because that’s going to be awkward. I always get pushed aside when it comes to my feelings as well.   I’ve always been told that I talk a lot or that I talk too much. That I’m annoying and etc. I didn’t realize how much it would follow me after school. It’s made my past couple weeks pretty bad.   I was talking with a customer one day and my manager was with me. We were trying to make a sale and the man was unsure. He said he was going to walk around and that he’d be back. My manager had turned to me and said that when she’s talking to not say anything because I made us lose a sale. I don’t understand how it was my fault?

title: I'm extremely jealous of influencers.
self_text: I know they're just people like me, but my life at the moment is just not great. I find myself watching vloggers and influencers on Instagram with this large following and I just think to myself, "Man, I wish I could be them." Have money. Be unconcerned with my financial situation. Have strangers that care about me. Be heard.   I feel like I have nothing going on with my life. I work two jobs and go to school full time. I don't have time for anything, not friends, not family, most of the time. I'm constantly busy with my degree. It'll probably be better once I've graduated, but. . .right now I'm struggling for money, struggling to eat, can barely make rent, all the while watching these people live their best lives and be in seemingly happy relationships and travel and buy stuff.   I thought about starting my own YouTube channel. Not just for the money or to be recognized, but because I think I could have a decent following if I put my mind to it. I've always had a comedic side and ever since I got social media I found myself making original content, and I really think about buying equipment and getting started on doing it seriously. But then I think to myself, "Who the hell would care about my content? Who would watch me?" And I get sad all over again.   Does anyone else experience this feeling? This feeling of, "Man I'm such a regular ass person, I've got nothing going on"? I want to do stuff. Be remembered for something, at least. Idk. I'm broke and sad and just wishing shit was different.

title: My wife wants the passwords to my devices
self_text: Hi all, I know this will be an issue that can be quite divisive and my position is that couples/individuals should do what feels right for them.  Me (35M) and my wife (31F) have been married for a year and a half, and have been together for just over 5 years. Since fairly early in the relationship she has asked for the passwords for my devices. I am someone who appreciates a little privacy in a relationship and have been very clear to say I am not okay with this.  I do give her access to all my devices when she asks. It's very common for her to ask for my phone if we've been out or on holiday so she can transfer photos to herself, so I unlock my phone, give it to her and go do my thing (eg. go to sleep, leave the room). I only mention the latter to say that I don't 'supervise' her using my devices. All my personal stuff (Gmail, Facebook, SMS, Whatsapp) would be accessible but I trust her not to open these things. She rarely needs to use my computer for anything but I do the same when she does ask. The only reason I would say no to her using either is if I am actively using them at the time. Suffice to say, I have no issue with her using my devices but I would like her to ask first.  She raised the point that she might need emergency access to my devices if I was incapacitated, which I think is reasonable. I have been setting up a password manager for myself, and it has a feature that would allow her access to everything (incl financial accounts, etc.) if needed. I don't restrict her access to financial accounts but she has no interest in our share investments so she doesn't have much to do with them.  My wife is very firm that she sees this as a lack of trust on my part.  TL;DR: Wife wants passwords for my phone and computer. I give her 'unsupervised' access to both whenever she asks but I would want her to ask me first.  Edit - given the nature of some of the replies: I should say that I don't think either of us is concerned about infidelity. It's mostly a situation where she wants unfettered access and me wanting to be asked for permission.

title: AITA for asking my boyfriend to work at the office 2 days a week?
self_text: My boyfriend (m35) and I (F34) live together with our son (m2). We both work 4 days a week and have 1 day with our son. My boyfriend has lost both his parents a couple of years ago and an unborn child with his previous partner. He’s had a hard time since then.   Since we’ve moved in together (3 years ago) my boyfriend has had issues with going to the office. We are both people that need space to function, for us that means being alone in the house. I have ADD so I really need my alone time. We agreed we would ‘give’ each other one day a week without the other one home. We also agreed we would be at the office when the other was home with our son.   My boyfriend always seemed to have a problem that could only be solved by working from home.  He’s had 3 jobs and all 3 jobs have made it ‘impossible’ for him to work at the office. He was reluctant to go because of covid, it was difficult because he had to ask permission to go to the office and now the reason is because he hates his job.   I’ve also asked him to please leave me alone while working, because I’m easily distracted and need a long time to regain my concentration. He agrees to -and it works for a week- after a week he starts to bother me again. When confronted he always says he is just happy and in the heat of the moment and forgets our agreement.   Al these years I have tried to ask him to work at the office, I’ve begged, pleaded, tried to talk though his difficulties, but to no avail.  I feel like I have no time alone, because I’m either with the baby or working, and when I’m working from home, he is also home. And he doesn’t leave me alone while I’m working. I’m losing my mind.  I quit my job 1 year ago because I was tired of not sleeping and I wanted to change jobs. Also because we had a lot of fights over the above and I thought that maybe quitting my job and finding some rest at home would help. It was a tough year for me. Also my dad died this summer. My boyfriend did what he could to support me. It included doing 50/50 housework, even though I was home, so I could have done 100%. I’m really grateful for this of course.   I’ve recently started a new job and I need to study for exams. So I really need my time alone.   So an hour ago I asked him to please work from the office for two days a week. He agreed and said he would try to work towards it, but that it would take time because it was difficult for him.  I also told me I had to work on trying to learn to concentrate while he is home. He feels as if he is being kicked out of the house.   I lost it and told him to please start working on his issues because it’s not normal to never go to the office.   So, aita? I feel like I’m the asshole here because I was home for an entire year and he helped me through it and he is obviously having larger issues here so I should be greatfull for the year he supported me and just suck it up and help him through his issues.  EDIT I’ve been informed I need to add this for clarity: I work from the office 3 days and work 1 day at home, as per our agreement, my bf doesn’t want to do 2 days at work and 2 at home. Also my boyfriend didn’t financially support me during my year off.

title: What should I do? I'm feeling extremely insecure and jealous. 6 years relationship, 2 in distance
self_text: See TD;LR in the last paragraph  First of all, english is not my first language so sorry in advance for any grammar or spelling mistakes. I currently find myself in the US but I was born abroad. Me (22F) and my boyfriend (22) have been together for the last 6 years. We started when we were very young and stupid, so we've lived a bunch of ups and downs and have learned from them. The biggest one was 4-5 years ago (we were 17) when I found out that he cheated on me. An aqcuaintance of mine sent me pictures of a couple of chats he had with two different girls asking them to hook up basically. I was never able to confirm what they did. One of the girls rejected him in the ss but I never confirmed anything about the other one. He admitted that the chats were real tho. Because I was young and naive, I forgave him even tho my heart and emotional stability were completely broken. After that, he changed for the better, but I was never able to completely heal from what happened.   In 2020, I was able to get a full athletic scholarship in North Carolina. This is important because flying to my country (where my boyfriend currently lives) takes 13 hours. Of course, I wasn't going to miss this opportunity and my bf fully supported my decision. It was really hard leaving him and my family behind but it was the best decision I could've made.   The first year was fine, we had ok communication and I was too busy in school and practice to pay much attention to details in our relationship. I was genuinely happy with my life. Then, he found a job in a different city from our hometown and I supported him as much as I could. But the problems started there. He doesn't like calls, so our first year we literally called each other at most twice. He would only talk to me through games voicechats (lol, valorant). I talked to him about how important it was for me to make calls but he never did it anyway. We can only see eachother twice a year for at most a week.  When he moved, he started hanging out with his friends more often. Many of these people are friends of mine or acquaintances, so it never felt off. It started to bother me when his female friends started staying at his house after parties and stuff. They are people I know, so he kind of expected me to be okay with it, but I still felt uneasy ~When I forgave him, I decided to trust him again, so I understand that I commited to not being jealous over things that aren't justified~. He once asked me if I was okay with him moving in with a girl (A) to reduce expenses and I immeadetely refuse. I feel like nothing good would come out of it. I asked him and myself multiple time why did it have to be a girl; he has boyfriends. I've been rooming only with girls because I respect my relationship and I wouldn't like him to feel uncomfortable.   At the end, he said that he wouldn't do it if that was going to affect our relationship, but he didn't think it should be that big of a deal because A loves and we used to be really close. Then, he started planning short trips to nearby towns with A. I was a bit annoyed because when I went to visit him he would play videogames most of the day with the excuse that I could also play. I asked him to do something like those trips but it never happened. Because of that, I decided to organize a trip to the beach. I bought the tickets and reserved everything, but he didn't help me at all. He payed his part, but he was not involved in the planning process. But whenever there is a girlfriend coming to his house, he prepares everything and find activities to keep them entertained. This made me feel jealous and down.   Right now a different girl from our past (lets call her L, she used to like him when we were not in a relationship and me and  her used to be good friends back then) is staying at his house. She traveled from our hometown to my bf's city just to spend time with him. She just broke up with his bf and her mom died years ago, so my bf said that it was a good reason for her to travel to him for comfort. I try to understand his and her position but I still feel betrayed. If he takes more than an hour to answer I can only imagine that he's cheating on me with her. I don't get how he finds so normal having a girl staying at his extremely small apartment for days and declining my phone calls when I'm trying to buy tickets to visit him. Also, he's been telling me all the activities and places they've visited, and that's the reason he doesn't pay attention to his phone. Activities include watching series and playing sports together.   Everything seems worse to me knowing that I've been insisting him for months, more than a year by now, to get his VISA's appointment and to send me his resume in english so that we can be here together. He says that he wants to come, that he wants to live with, me but he hasn't done anything!  ~We've already talked about marriage and organizing a life together in the past. He's usually the one talking about it and insisting in making life projects together.~  I will travel this week home but it might be the last time in the next 5 years. I remind him too often to do these things, but he shows concern for the next 5 minutes and then just forgets about it for another month. I don't know if all of this is worth it. He's so calm about it that it makes me feel like I'm the one overreacting. I just want to know how far from being objective I am. I just want to escape but I can't forget all the beautiful things he's done for me everytime I try. I know I only said the bad stuff but he has supported me in my worst moments. Knowing that we'll be together in two weeks, what should I tell him? Feel free to ask for more context, even tho this is already long lol.  TL;DR: Me (22F), BF (22M), 6 years together, 2 distance  We live in different countries. He doesn't live in my hometown anymore, so it's even harder to see each other. title: AITA for not liking a coworker?
self_text: I've(22M) have been working at a office for the past year. you see, everything was fine there was little to no drama and i've made good friends there. Recently we have had a new employee (Zack 18-20M) In the beginning Zack seemed like a nice person and I was amazed by him, I became his friend, something however was off about him after a while whenever I came into work I always see Zack being the center of attention by saying stupid stuff, controlling what others do and getting his way. everyone seemed to love him because he always said what they wanted to hear and he always was nice to them. at first it didn't bother me the dude is just being himself I can respect that, I even found out we shared the same birthday and treated him like a brother.  after a while I often heard Zack badmouth people behind their backs simply because other co-workers didn't like them. at one point it felt like I was going insane because of Zack, wondering if i'm overreacting about the guy or just going crazy, my therapist told me to avoid Zack as he is a Narcissist.  So yeah I avoided the guy I didn't want any trouble I always go into work with the motive of just getting through the day. Eventually zack found out and wanted to talk (Only people that knew I didn't like him were my friends) me and Zack talked for a bit and we came to an understanding I forgave him and treated my mistrust of him as just a misunderstanding.  We became buds again and everything was fine, not until he had the office in uproar over what he thought was a minor mistake I made and could have fixed instantly, I tried to explain myself but he wasn't listening, My boss had to intervene and told me to leave the office and go home for the day he told Zack to apologise to me but Zack said since I hated him he will never apologise, and now the entire office knew I didn't like him.  Now we are back where we started I avoid Zack and try not to talk to him unless my work needs me to. Zack was offended. my co-workers who were nosy then came to me asking me why I don't hang with them anymore, I confessed that my therapist told me to avoid all encounters with Zack. Zack overhead me and started bitching about it cursing me and telling me a bunch of nonsense, our boss just stood there and watch him yell at me.  few months later I forgave Zack again and I told him I did, the first thing he does after that is try to get under my skin by showing me a picture from a manga panel of a character saying they hate another. I tried to explain to Zack that no its not us because we are cool now, HR intervenes and tell me to go home to avoid another argument.  Now my friends want me to forgive Zack because they somehow forget all the terrible things he does, my friends then did a 180 on me accusing me of being Jealous of him and somehow i'm the asshole when I wanted to just avoid the guy.

title: I'm not a good brother or son or friend and I genuinely don't care

I was with my brother the other day driving in house car to pick up our Xbox and he started having a conversation with me. Asking about if I'm looking for a relationship, if I want one, if there was anybody I liked. And I kept giving him short answers. I said I do eventually but I'm not looking for anyone right now.   I especially just hate him because he's in a good healthy relationship and I'm jealous because he wouldn't have been a better brother to me without her. And they're both home making sure everyone knows they're happy.  I hate seeing my childhood bully get to be happy after everything he's done to me and said to me with almost no feeling bad because it's in the past but I still remember everything and feel it every day. I doubt he would of even cared that I had cut myself if he didn't have his girlfriend.  My dad decided to look at my scars and loudly ask "Oh have you been cutting again?" With a joking tone. And he's seen them before and never decided to ask before so why on Thanksgiving?   When he first found out he decided to make it all about himself.  When he found out I was suicidal he said "If you feel like hitting something hit me"   Every single time they get on my nerves and can visibly tell they decide to get all defensive and get mad at me for having any other emotions other than be happy that they're jerks to me and always have been.  I have good talks about my life with my youth pastor but his son (18) body shamed my (ex) girlfriend (19) and is one of the main reasons we broke up. And he refuses to take responsibility. He only hated her because he was single even though he's made out with 5 or 6 girls within one school year. He thinks he's better than everyone else now just because he has a good Christian girlfriend, and so now he doesn't need to take part in the arguments about how he ruined the only good thing I had going for me.  I want to hurt them all how they hurt me and I know I can but what if everyone turns against me again?  I feel trapped and I know the only escape is suicide.

title: AITA For 'letting' my muslim friend eat something with pork in it?
self_text: Context required. So I was attending a wedding last week and it was between my long-time friend and his girlfriend of 6 years. My friend, who I'll call John, is muslim and doesn't live in the U.S. I met him online and we've been friends for almost 10 years. John is also friends with the groom. John decided to come here and visit and to attend the wedding.  So here's the situation. He got here a few days before the wedding and crashed at my place. He asked if it was cool if I made sure anything he ate / was planning on eating during his stay was halal. (Doesn't contain pork, alcohol, etc.) I agreed and I made sure to cook things for us that didn't include anything like that. I decided it would be best not to take him out to eat or get fast food because it would be really hard to tell.  So come the day of the wedding, we obviously aren't together the whole time at the event. Still, John wants to enjoy some food and drinks, understandable, but can't find me. So he'd just ask other people or just stay away. On one occasion, John did find me and asked if a little appetizer thing he had had pork or anything in it. I honestly didn't know so I said, "I don't know, but I'd assume not." So he ate it. Later on though, he found out it did have pork in it, and got angry at me. I told him that I just said what I knew, that I didn't know. I told him that he took the chance and that's on him.  Did I do wrong here?

title: Ex I broke up with 5 years ago, made a fake Instagram account and is now harassing my friends (I don't have any social media). What can I do?
self_text: I broke up with the alcoholic man child 5 years ago. Had constant harassment from him for over a year. Asked the police to have a word with him, which kindly they did. I changed my number and set my social media to private. That seemed to fix the problem, for about a year. Then I received a notice from small claims court that I owed him money. We had lived together for a year and I paid my half of rent, utilities, etc. to him and he then added his half and paid it all in full. Split down the middle evenly on all costs.  They asked if I wanted mediation, I said hell no, this is going to court. His "evidence" he provided was an Excel spreadsheet he created. I countered with certified bank statements.  He withdrew his claim. Having now looked more closely over the "bills spreadsheet" he created he had added expenses on that weren't mine to pay (I had overpaid him by £1400). He kept insisting I owed him "more money" and never gave me access to the spreadsheet before his small claims court case.That was 2 years ago.   A month ago a friend of mine sends me screenshots of someone saying I owe them a shit ton of money. My friend told him to stop hiding behind a fake account and fuck off. Why he's decided, 2 years later, to start up his harassment again I don't know. Probably drunk, single and bored again, as usual.  So basically I have 2 questions:    Do I go after him for the overpayment?    How can I get him to leave my friends / myself alone?

title: AITA for replying this way to my mom after being scolded?
self_text: I was studying for my university finals which I had in 2 days, my mother had just came back from a day trip to Msia with my uncle and auntie, I had studied the whole day without my earpiece on as I was not feeling the mood to listen to music while studying. 2 minutes earlier I decided to put on my earpiece(noise cancelling kind) to listen to some music and she came home, she had the keys, and barged into my room without warning. WIth a dark look on her face, she stood at my doorway and spoke to me in a harsh voice.” Did you know I knocked your window for 3 times you didn’t came to the door to help me with the things I bought. “, I said "Im sorry I had earpiece on", “she replied, what is the doorbell for?” I then spoke, “For the person in the house to know that there is someone at the door”, “She then cuts me off, saying” do you know how dangerous it is to not be able to hear what is happening outside the house, what if there is a fire?” She continued, “ why do you have your earpiece on” “I just put it on not long ago, Im sorry that I didn’t hear your doorbell ringing, if it is my fault that I didn’t hear the doorbell ringing as I just put on my earpiece to listen to music, 2 mins earlier only, I’lll apologise,” “she stayed silent and I then continued,” im sorry that I didn’t hear the doorbell, I should be more careful next time, I won’t—“ she cuts me off but shutting my door and walked off without listening to what I had to say. It was not a regular door shutting but a big swing and my door then slammed. Am I the bad person for crying or for defending myself? Now im pretty sure she is pissed at me because of my tone, which I always tend to sound like and look like im angry. I am feeling not remorseful but very hurt, and I feel like I have been accused and scolded, my emotions are now haywire and it makes me hard to focus on continuing to study thus writing this down to pour out my overwhelming emotions and feelings so I can feel better because I feel like crying, but I have no time cos you know uni finals exam in 2 days.

title: AITA for asking my in laws to step back a little on their free help?
self_text: Hello!  So, my husband and I bought our first home together in January. It is a fixer upper and has needed a LOT of work put into it.  Luckily, our family’s have been great at helping us and we are so thankful, but now my in laws are getting overwhelming and overstepping.   For context, my mother in law has issues with boundaries and over steps quite a bit, but her other child doesn’t speak to her or allow her around her family so I’ve been trying to keep the peace and be good to her.   The moment we closed on the house, she had a “punch list” of plans for it. We wanted to include her, so we did. Some things she planned were things we asked for help with and were super helpful, some were unsolicited and overwhelming and unnecessary   Again, She really wanted to be involved and help with the planning and doing of the renovations so we allowed her and her husband to plan the kitchen, help us put together the kitchen, plan the master bathroom, etc.  however, I quickly learned that if we gave her an inch, she’d take a mile.  The renovations started getting completely overwhelming and not at all fun like my husband and I hoped for. She would come into the house and boss us around with stuff. If she didn’t think we or our contractors were moving fast enough, she would push us.  She has started to make plans for our home that are not important to us and out of budget. And even though we have said no to some of them, she still insists that we are going to consider and do what she plans because she has done this before and her way is best.  Now she is planning our layouts for our closets, our basement, the outside space, etc. this is all stuff my husband and I wanted to plan together and then ask for help if/when needed. I told her that it was becoming overwhelming and that we were happy to continue to let them help, but we were going to by our plans and she was only going to be helping with things we specifically ask for.  They also try to make last minute plans on the weekend to do stuff at the house, and I told her that in the future we  would need to plan ahead for stuff .  She called me a control freak and insinuated that we are ungrateful for their “free help”.  I’m not at all ungrateful. I’m SO grateful that they’ve helped and they can totally be involved.  The free help is just effecting me emotionally now and it’s no longer free. I just need some boundaries and am a person who needs a little planning and structure.  Am I the asshole for asking her to back off a little (respectfully)?

title: Why does baby wake every hour in early morning?
self_text: My 3 month old (15 weeks) wakes every two to three hours hungry overnight which is a huge recent improvement for my sleep. So no problem with that.   But she now wakes at 4am (normal I feed), 5am & 6am not hungry, she’s not able to get back to sleep; if she doesn’t cry out for food she immediately heads back to sleep once held. So we have to then hold her for 20 mins before placing back in bassinet.  Things we’ve tried:  Waiting her out longer in hope she will connect sleep cycles. Then we are both up listening to her get more awake and work her hands out of the swaddle. (This also doesn’t work for naps ever)  Feeding her both sides at 4am which works if she’s wants more food then. She’ll sleep through randomly on one side too. She only nurses both sides 10% of the time, I offer and am usually met with strong closed mouth and even loud protest sometimes.   Patting her/ holding down her arms/ helping with possible gas, in bassinet but that still takes 20 minutes so it’s easier to hold her. I’ll do this occasionally in the middle of the night.  Temp? She runs warm naturally. The room is around 65-68  recently at night and she’s in a cotton sleeper and a smart temp halo swaddle.  The reason I stopped trying to feed her at these early morning wakes is, one,  she sometimes wouldn’t even open her mouth and two, if she eats then she won’t nurse before I head to work (or even for 3+ hours!) which is problematic because I only can pump twice while at work.   Thoughts?  suggestions?

I AM SO FUCKING TIRED OF THIS BULLSHIT DAY IN DAY OUT WITH NO FUCKING BREAKS ANYMORE.  i left her four months ago and i still can't fucking stop thinking about her. i continuously find myself back in her house, back in our room, back with her doing that godawful bullshit to me. i fucking wake up to her screaming at me at 2 in the morning and i have to check the whole house twice to make sure it's not real before i can go back to my room. all the time. over. and over. and fucking  over . i'm so tired of it. i feel like i've been broken or something. i'm not supposed to be like this, i'm meant to be the one who's stable and okay and normal. it's been hard to leave my house lately and trick-or-treating was literally my only fucking escape and i was jumpy and paranoid the whole fucking time. at this point i'm close to giving up and ending it because literally fucking nothing matters when you're haunted by someone you left four months ago. i just want it all to stop for the love of god

title: I (18M) want to get back with an ex (19F) afterour telationship silently ended
self_text: So about a year and a half ago I went to school with a girl I liked, she is a year older than me and I could only see her during break times or intervals when walking to my next class. We both liked each other a lot and I finally had the courage of asking her for her number inwhich we called each other everyday and would stay up all night talking until one of us got caught by our parents or fell asleep on call. We actually went on a date this one time, there was alot of teasing and she actually put me in a lot of positions to ask her out but being my naive self, never picked up those hints or was to innocent to actually proceed through without overthinking it.  I asked her to the school dance and she said maybe. Back then I thought that I was losing her but now I see she may have just wanted to go with friends to the dance and meet me at the ball itself. The only problem was I got kicked out a week after asking her out, I was more focused on wtf I'm suppose to do school wise because now its halfway through the year and idk where to go or what to do. I completely forgot that I was suppose to go to the school dance with my crush until I saw the photos of her at the dance in the background on one of my friend Instagram posts. I felt like it was to late to text her because it had already been a week after the dance (4 weeks since I asked her out).  I kept thinking about texting her through out the rest of the year but never had the guts to actually get in contact (She also didn't reach out to me in any way). I was about to delete Instagram deciding I didn't want to deal with people spreading rumours about how I got kicked out or private messages telling me I should go kill myself because of something that was made up by the guy (who I beat up) friends group. I finally decide to text her telling her that it was good knowing her and she told me to fuck off.  Im about to graduate and its been about a year since ive seen her and have been thinking about her alot recently. Im wondering if I should start a new Instagram account to try and reach out to her although I have no intentions of posting on that account or using it, or just swinging by her uncles place and asking if she's home and that I could speak with her.  Should I try and get back together with my ex after a year and a half apart or just continue how I am wishing I could see her again?

title: I hate life
self_text: I (28) am just so damn sick of it. Rent is constantly going up in my area. I still can't make enough to move out much less without being broke. I can't get into my preferred career fields because of a bunch of arbitrary crap and I'm always single, my teachers sort of screwed me over and my childhood sucked. Even finding a job in a different city is bloody impossible for me.  Even with therapy and anti-depressants, life is at best just tolerable. I don't feel passionate about my much anymore, even when I accomplish my smaller goals it doesn't feel great.  I feel condemned to live and I'm just done but I don't know what to do.  I need to change my material circumstances but I'm running up against some major obstacles that I doubt I can overcome. I feel like I can never leave my working class background and life is waste. I know I could do so much with my if given the chance

title: Guilt?
self_text: Hi everyone, i am the dumper of our 4 yr relationship. I tried so hard for years and years to be with him because i love him so much. I just couldnt do it anymore and the relationship was getting toxic. No matter how much i want to be with him i know this is the right thing to do. One if our main issues was he could never do anything on his own, i always had to help him or do it myself. I wasnt able to rely on my partner for anything and i felt like i was raising a child instead of being in a partnership. I feel so guilty and i feel like if he becomes unsuccessful its my fault bc i should be there for him. I used to apply to jobs for him, do his assignments and even help with his online exams. He would always get anxiety about those things and especially about his future plans. I feel so guilty for leaving him because i dont want him to “fail” at life. He doesnt really try he has no ambition for anything and i feel like without me hes going to be lost. I feel so guilty but ik he needs to learn to be on his own and be independent, but how do i get past the guilt? I hope i dont sound conceited or anything, he was a great guy my best friend my everything, but I dont want to be his mother and thats why I had to break up with him.

title: Am I a bad girlfriend?
self_text: A couple of nights ago, I (F23) hurt my boyfriend's (M29) feelings. As far as I know this is the second time I've done so. We've been together for three years but weren't able to celebrate our anniversary (3 years) due to Thanksgiving but also being long distant (different states).  This past year has been nothing but filled with stress. My boyfriend backed out of living together last minute because he felt he needed to have this new job and experience on his own (he's been taking care of his family since he was a child) and almost broke up with me due to the guilt. My dementia ridden demon of a grandmother moved in with my parents and gave us absolute hell for five months (she'd corner me and say vulgar things). My new promotion has been a nightmare with how much lack of respect my coworkers have for anything or anyone (no one shows up and I'm burned out). And lastly, I decided to finally go back to school full time after experiencing a serious injury. My school, work, and family life have been battling each other nonstop and I'm slowly losing it.  I'm an introvert but become a very talkative person when I feel close to someone. I'm also very used to being talked over and ignored by my family that when I'm matched with a listener-I can go on and on and on. My boyfriend is a listener. He's afraid of rocking the boat with his opinions while I express everything I feel or think. Sometimes it's really hard for me to get a full answer about our relationship from him without a silent smile, a lighthearted chuckle, or a "you're so cute". Therefore I don't press the issue since I don't want to pressure him into a conversation he clearly isn't ready for causing me to just assume what he's thinking.  Since I started this new job, I've become subject to inappropriate habits like gossiping/complaining. Each time he asked how my day was, I would go into play by play mode. That's when he first started stating his displeasure (thank god). He told me he didn't want to hear every single detail about my day and that I needed to condense it. I felt a little hurt but I got over it. He was right. Who wants to hear about constant negativity? So, I tried to take note.   Things Not to Do    Don’t talk too much about day. People don’t care.    Make sure not to repeat the same things (tangents aren’t good).    Your being annoying stop it.   Now there would be occasions where the day was so bad that I couldn't prevent myself from complaining but I did try to keep it to a minimum.   Now fast forward a few months later and things are looking great. He's opening up to me more and telling me that he's starting to plan for the future (hinting that I was potentially in it). Then one night, over the phone, while he was relaying his weekend he suddenly stopped. In a discouraged voice he said it didn't seem like I was very interested in anything that he was saying and that we should end the call. I panicked. I started to profusely apologize. It wasn't that I didn't care. I was listening but the damage was done. I don't really remember why I felt distant to him-it might've been that he promised to call me the day before but didn't and I was feeling a little butt hurt or I was really tired from work-but I seriously can't remember. I called him immediately the next morning to properly apologize for making him seem insignificant. He stated that I listen but don't ask for further details. I told him that I forget that everyone else isn't like me. They don't give every single detail of an event that took place without being asked. I respect people's privacy so much that I believe that they'll tell me all the information that I think they want me to know and nothing more. I'm afraid of crossing too far into people's personal lives. I told him that I would try and be more mindful since we're so different and he accepted my apology. We moved on.  As of late, being both a full time student and worker has been taking a toll on me. I hardly eat or sleep. I'm constantly stressed and haven't been able to turn to those near me for comfort. I think perhaps the complaining has resurfaced again. My worries have started growing which are partially also due to him asking me to move in with him again only 8 months after going back on his word the last time. I didn't know how to react and made a joke about how he was going to have to provide me with an offer I couldn't refuse. We laughed it off but threw around the idea of me visiting for the whole summer. Fast forward two weeks later, finals are coming up and now I'm getting called into work on my days off putting me on edge. I'm slowly losing it and expressing my anxiety to almost anyone who will listen. I'm working 10+ hours, getting up at 3:30 in the morning, and feeling so exhausted that I fall asleep before I can get any school work done. This has caused me to become really bad at calling or texting my boyfriend back due to all of this.   Then Saturday night rolls around. I wake up to a call from my boyfriend. He's telling me something about how fun Friendsgiving was and the Black Friday shenanigans he had with the boys. I'm in and out of consciousness only responding to concern about a friend who hasn't been in contact in days (I should've taken my boyfriend's advice and talked to him when I was awake the following day but I was selfish). I barely remember the conversation that night but I suddenly started crying and voicing all of my insecurities right then and there. A total emotional vomit. I felt ashamed after it happened and tried to change the subject- too bad it was an even stupider one. We had been making plans for me to visit at the beginning of the year for my birthday but I was thinking of postponing it until the spring so I could safe up more money and pay for school. He didn't like that train of thought (he's been wanting me to quit but the wage is just too good). I then tried to be cute and say that I'd be willing to change my mind if he could give me an offer I couldn't refuse (I need to expand my vocabulary-I KNOW). I was expecting him to reply with "ME", to which I was going to say "That's a really good offer. Looks like I can't refuse". Instead he replied with "Wow, okay. That kind of hurt my feelings". I was shocked. "Really?" "Yes.  I tried saying that I was sorry and that I meant it as a joke but the conversation was over.  He's been distant since then. I gave him two days then texted him that we needed to talk about what happened that night. I apologized and admitted fault for what I did and said. I asked what he was feeling to which he replied with that he really appreciated me wanting apologize but that he needed time to process his feelings. He felt like our relationship was transactional and to give him time and that he would contact me.  I'm distraught. This isn't the first time that he's asked for space (the first time was when he backed out of wanting to live together) and I'm getting flashbacks.  TLDR:  Boyfriend is asking for space again so he can process his feelings after I made a joke. He believes that our relationship is transactional, feels resentful, and probably thinks that I am selfish and only concerned about myself. Am I really that bad? Can I fix it? or, did I really screw everything up?

title: was it my fault?
self_text: me and my ex best friend had been friends for 6 years. attached at the hip, were part of eachothers families, and knew eachother better than we knew ourselves. my grandmother recently died. we were extremely close so i haven’t been myself lately and haven’t had the energy to be a good friend. my ex best friend complained about how i haven’t been talking to her as much recently and how i “seem like i would rather be doing anything than talking to her”. i replied and said that it’s been hard for me to be normal in general, but especially with her because i’ve felt like i haven’t had support after my grandmothers death, and that i expected more from her. she sent back an extremely long, defensive text about how she was the one who helped me pack before the funeral and how she came to see me once and tried to consistently talk to me. she claimed that there was nothing she could’ve physically done more and that she has nothing left to offer. i replied in the same rude tone she did and said that she did not try to consistently talk to me and provided proof, said she only came over once for an hour, and didn’t check up on me. to that she responded that weve had many differences in our relationship and we should go out separate ways. i was completely caught off guard because ending our friendship was off of the table for me. we’ve been through so much together that it couldn’t be true to me. i tried asking what differences because we haven’t fought in over a year. i tried calling her, reaching out to her boyfriend , and sending her many texts about how i want to hear her out and that if i was a bad friend i wanna know what u have to say. i begged for closure but she seemed to flip a switch and turn her emotions off. her responses after that were one lined, and cold hearted. at the end she told me there would be no productive conversation to be had and that i need to let it go. i can’t figure out where we went wrong, and i never will.

title: Shy girl admited after years have a crush on me and somehow I ruined everything
self_text: I met her at psycology university but I moved after 1 Month so we Spoke only 3 or 4 Times. She got my superficial attention but I was in a long term relationship already (with the girl who would betray me with my "bestfriend" in the future LOL) She add me on Instagram and from time to time (like every few weeks or months) She would texted me and Run off basically. Meanwhile I was single and I Started replying more to her texts but She always would Run away and ghost me for weeks or months. It was a cycle. After 5 years of this She invited me to grab a beer and it was very good for both of us. But she didnt answered for like a week right after that day and I was like here we go again ghost time and She didnt like me. So ok byebye.  After a while somehow we were talking everyday (maybe because everytime I step back She would immediatly "go after me") but we met 2 more Times and same thing happened. At this time I was the King of the ghosts and I decided I had enough and told her Next time I would have to give up on knowing her Better and go with my life which She ignored completely and only answer to the not important parts of the conversation like everytime I tried to be a bit more frontal about the situation and the feelings envolved or not.   After a lot while (lol) She texted me saying she always had a crush on me and now her therapyst encouraged her to fight her fears and admiting this was One of them Thats why She would always Run away.  At this time I am again a person, I feel the blood on my body and I'm no longer a ghost because now I understand some things. I sent her a picture of the christmas gifts I bought and never Gave her.  But unfortnately at the same time now I was very septycal about her actions and my foreing cousin, One of my best friends, which I didnt see for 5 years was staying in my house for 2months and no way She would be a priority.  Anyway she invited me to go to a quizz with her friends which I found disapropriate because I felt we first needed to be a bit more Alone after her confession to really see a bit of our compabitility once for all (Im not talking about kissing and touching) and thou we talked everyday I did not do efforrts to meet her until my cousin left.  When he left we went to a dinossaur Museum and it was the first time I felt we "dated" and there were chemistry. She ended up suggesting we go to drink on a bar after and we spended 12hours together. In the end I Gave her the "christmas gifts" and took her home. She texted me saying She liked a lot and right after that again left me a few days on ghost. I get very anxious and now I took some Steps back because Im Also insecure and dont want to "force" her into liking me, she have to understand that by herself after all my signs or in a long Run it Will not work for me.  We got back to talking everyday but now I wanted some answers which it was dificult because She always ignored when I Open up a bit of what I feel about this. And She Said I never invited her to anything. I Reply with honesty and Also ensure her I wanted to meet her once again and only wanted to understand if She Also wanted that or not. No answer for that. Again. Either way I told her I was out of town but in 2 weeks we could meet and we kept talking everyday.  When I came back She suddenly invites me to go to a climate protest with her colleagues because "She was helping the organization and was told to invite anyone who was interested" which I replied I would love to go with her but under other circunstancies and if She want the Next day I could arrange everything just tell me if you can and want. No answer. I was fucking confused and wanted to talk to her once for all ALONE.  After 1 day she only told me was expecting me to go with her to the protest because few days ago I Said was interested in being more active in supporting this type of causes BUT no answer about the rest.  I now be a man and told her I was off, a lot of confusion and incompabitiliy and its Better we dont continue talking but She could count on me if She had any problem. She only answered on the Next day talking about a dog who was adopted. Sent her a 5min voice message being completely honest about everything and no reaction from her.   And now I'm the One with the crush on her because I cant accept the fact I ruined everything with a girl who had a crush on me for years and she's probably gonne without actually having a conversation about all this.  PS: 1 week have passed and now I'm thinking of sending her a text for her to just say something acknowledging what I said because its a tremenduos disrespect after all this time not to say at least an "Ok" since we had a great relationship of mutual respect.

title: AITA for leaving with my daughter on thanksgiving dinner and telling her mom she’s insecure?
self_text: I had my daughter when I was really young and I’ve raised her since she was little when her mom gave her up.   She’s 14 her mom reached out to me asking for her to come with her and with my daughters okay she went over, second time she’s met her.   They Invited me as well but I wasn’t interested in going, but my daughter didn’t want to go alone.  When we did go at first everyone was Inviting her grandparents welcomed my daughter quickly and started asking her questions and at first it was okay.   it’s relevant to know that my kid isnt fat, she’s not even over weight period   there was a lot of people so there was a lot of food to eat, my daughter was making a plate when her mom came over specifically to tell her to not put to many rolls on her plate. My reaction was maybe they just needed to save some for the guests and I had no idea what it was about,  Second times was when her mom walked over again and made her put back food, told her that she didn’t really didn’t need to eat so much and made her her plate, with actually very little and three out of the 11 things they had made. I pulled her aside and asked her if there was a reason she was doing this so I could inform my daughter but she said no of course not they made plenty and she was just helping her because there was too much on the plate.  I said that she usually eats it and if wasted food was an issue we will always take whatever she didn’t eat home and she eats it then, I was trying to be the most open minded and that this was just tone deaf.  When we had sat down my daughter ate everything on her plate and her mom stopped her and said no “don’t go grab anymore because she will get  more  ….. bloated    I told her to get some if she will finish it, and told her mom to not say stuff like that to my daughter and don’t make her try to worry about her weight that’s not a concern to anyone but her doctor.   Last straw was when I went to the bathroom and came out to see her trying to take my daughters plate away and throw it out telling her that she didn’t need anymore food and to just listen when someone says stop eating.   I walked over and grabbed both of our jackets and said okay let’s go. Thanked everyone for the food. Her mom got mad that I was leaving and said that I was being over dramatic about this. I told my daughter to go to the car and when she left I said that she was so fucking ridiculous to tell that to a fourteen year old and just because she was overweight doesn’t give her any damn right to project her insecurities onto my kid.   She ignored that and said that I can’t get it into my head that it’s our kid. I said that the fact that she just ignored me telling her she’s hurting her kid shows me she isn’t ready to have her in her life.   I’m told that leaving like that was wrong and bringing up her weight was a low blow, and that I should have just clarified to my daughter it was okay to eat it.  Edit:  Hi! Your daughter needs to learn how to eat in moderation, she needs to be taught to serve a little bit of food at a time, finish it and wait a little bit more to see if she’s still hungry before getting more. Piling up her plate with food isn’t a good habit   a message I just received from a lady who has  messaged me about my daughter without even reading the post. She ate it all, and didn’t get a chance to make her plate because it was taken. Still ate it all, and asked for more. Please read and comprehend before moving forward.

title: Let Sleeping Dogs Lie?
self_text: I hope I don’t sound dumb but I’m wondering if it would be a bad idea to reach out to a guy (28M) I (24F) had a thing with about 5 years ago.   It was very very short lived—like a matter of days—but also very emotional for both of us - we had both gotten out of bad relationships and I guess we were both a bit vulnerable. I understand how insane that sounds—especially as a proponent of taking the time to get to know someone before jumping into something—but I guess stuff like that happens sometimes. We decided to stop talking as I would be going back to college which was far from our hometowns and we both needed time to heal. We were both very emotional and upset to cut things off and I even remember him saying something along the lines of “maybe you can call me when you graduate, though it might be a bit insane for you to have my number at that point.” It’s been two years since I graduated now. I have briefly thought about him every once in a while.  I deleted his number years ago but I have seen him pop up on my recommended instagram follows recently, which is interesting. Could that mean he still has my number? Idk how Instagram works.  I looked through my laptop and saw it saved the entire text conversation, so although I don’t have his number in my contacts it’s still saved there.  I feel like it sounds insane and maybe I just feel like being chaotic, but I’m wondering if I should reach out. We ended on good terms and it’s not like we blocked each other anywhere. I’m wondering if I should send a friend request or even a quick text saying I found our old conversation and that I hope he’s doing well. However, I also don’t know if he’s involved with someone else, which could be likely at this point.   My friends have said I can do what I want but they don’t see the point of going back to the past when I can instead just keep moving forward. I agree to a certain extent, but I feel like it couldn’t hurt to simply reach out. Should I just let sleeping dogs lie?  TL;DR is it a bad idea to send a brief hello message to someone I had a short yet emotional thing with 5 years ago?

title: I (32F) still have feelings for my best friend (32M). What's the best way to move forward?
self_text: Hi internet friends, I think I need a sanity check on my situation that happened over the last 6 months. Buckle up, this is a long one.  I (32F) have had a best friend Jerry (32M) for many years now. We had met in college and our friendship clicked, and we’ve been close ever since. For the last 13 years, I would say we bonded because we had a similar family background and values. Our dynamic is mostly banter but I could always turn to him to have serious convos about big life things. He had been a rock throughout my major life moments and I couldn’t imagine life without him in it.  Jerry is newly single after a LTR. While he was in this relationship, he actually confessed that he had feelings for me. It felt out of the blue and I told him I had always seen him as a best friend but nothing more. I also told him that he needed to figure things out with his girlfriend. The thought of us being more that friends just never existed in my mind, but after he confessed, I actually entertained the thought and asked myself what it could look like if we would start dating.  Jerry ends up breaking up with his girlfriend 2 months after the confession. I have no doubt that his “feelings” about me could’ve tipped his relationship over the edge, and I don’t want to pretend I’m completely innocent in this situation while it was unraveling. After he tells me, we end up chatting more as I support him through the breakup (something we’ve done for each other through all our breakups).  Long story short, Jerry and I spend more time with each other this summer and I can feel myself getting closer to him and start to see him in a different light. This felt like it the start of something amazing: dating your best friend and having friendship as the foundation of a romantic relationship. As we were spending more time together, so many things (red flags?) were popping up: 1) I felt so much guilt about seeing him so soon after his relationship ended 2) the fact that we started seeing each other without his ex-gf knowing or anyone knowing 3) the fact that I might be used as some sort for safe space as he transitions out of this relationship. These were some feelings that were starting to eat away at me, but nevertheless, I felt attached and felt like I could be falling in love.  As the summer went on, we started getting into more fights. Part of having stronger feelings was having more expectations. There was a pattern in our fights that was clear to me: he was hyper-defensive and didn’t know how to give me emotional space to speak my feelings or be heard, and he didn't know how to acknowledge and apologize for his part in situations. In these fights, we would get heated but we would eventually talk it through. We had one fight where it led to a complete blowout and I had to walk out. We ended up talking about the argument and realized that he was not ready for a relationship (we knew that) and that it was best we stay friends.  That brings us to today. And while are technically friends, we have kept chatting and hung out a few times. During these hangouts, he even told me that he loved me, and imagined having a future together - but regardless, he still felt unready for a relationship. He also said things like he would tell me when he was ready - and made it feel like he was going to work on himself. And if I was still available after all that, we can give it a try. While this logically makes sense, I'm emotionally more confused than ever.  Last night Jerry basically told me he went on a date with someone else and that felt like a knife to the heart. While I support him dating around as a newly single person, emotionally it was hard for me to be around him as he did this. I told him it was good that he told me, but that I think it would be better to stop talking even as friends. This whole situation makes me feel used and that I was being treated like some sort of backup option, or that we were waiting to replace each other.  So here I am, having declared that we should stop talking so I don’t get emotionally tied to him while I know he has the right to date other people. My mind and emotions are such a wreck. I’ve been dealing with the disappointment of the situation but also him as a person - that he could do all this without considering my feelings, or tell me he loved me and still go in dates with other women. Or that it really made me question my choices and my worth if someone who I trusted so much and was 13 years my best friend could still toss me to the side like this.  I’m feeling down and just looking for some perspective on this massive essay I just type out. Am I doing the right thing for myself in cutting communications now? Can anyone really resume being just friends after something like this? What’s the right mindset to have to move forward from this?  TL;DR - starting dating my guy best friend after he just got out of a LTR. It didn’t work out bc he’s not ready for a relationship yet. He says he loves me, but now he is dating other people.

title: AITA for not going to my sister's birthday party because she refused to apologise for ruining my reputation?
self_text: I [F28] have a younger sister Jodie [F23].  So Jodie is a single mom, she has a daughter, [F6].  I frequently help her out by picking up my niece from school and babysitting for a few hours for free so that Jodie can work. Jodie lives with our parents, and a boyfriend [M26] who she's been seeing for a couple of months.  In early October, at one point, Jodie accused me of using the family computer in our parents' home to go on gambling websites and signing up with our mom's debit card while I was babysitting. I told Jodie that's not true at all and asked her why on earth she would think that.  Jodie explained that money was disappearing from our mom's bank account and that she checked the computer's browser history and that gambling websites came up.  To be honest, I was kind of offended that Jodie would think I'd do something like that. I've never had a gambling problem and I've never stolen from anyone. I told Jodie that that's awful but that it wasn't me who did it.  She didn't believe me and went and told a load of our extended family that I was apparently stealing our mom's money to go on gambling websites, and now they all think I'm a horrible person and many of them have blocked me on Facebook.  Anyway, the next week, Jodie got back in touch with me. She said that she found a gambling website on her boyfriend's phone and connected the dots, and he admitted that it was him who was stealing our mom's money and going on gambling websites.  However, Jodie refused to apologise to me for jumping to conclusions and basically ruining my reputation with our extended family. Sure, I never speak to them anyway, but it's still a terrible reputation to have especially when it's undeserved.  Jodie said that it's my own fault because apparently I "acted guilty" and said that I got too defensive when she accused me.  Later in October was Jodie's birthday and she had a big party with our extended family. I decided to give Jodie her gifts a couple of days before, but refused to go to the party. I didn't want to go because I didn't want to deal with all the questions and judgement, and I was still really angry at Jodie for not even apologising for what she did.  My parents are understanding but Jodie said I'm an asshole for not attending her party and that if I'm going to be that way then I shouldn't bother being a part of the family, and accused me of being petty.

title: My local Walmart now thinks I'm a thief?!
self_text: This is going to be long, just a heads up. Not sure what the point of this is other than for outside opinions. Maybe it's just my typical anxiety of thinking everyone is looking at or talking about me all the time anywhere or maybe I have a valid reason for having a bad taste in my mouth after my last grocery visit. A few days ago, I went to my local Walmart that I visit at least once a week. My almost 2 year old was with me while my 4 year old was at preschool, for context. Grocery shopping with a toddler is distracting and makes your trip twice as long- we all know that. Anyways, I went to self checkout as always because I am particular about how my things are bagged and rang up my groceries. The last thing I got before checking out was play sand, which I had to walk to the garden center for and then ask an associate to get it for me since it was outside the garden gates and I had a full cart and my toddler. I waited while the associate got the sand, and as I'm waiting, the cashier in the garden center says out of nowhere to me when I'm not even looking at her "it's going to be at least an hour before I can get to you because we're doing toys for tots back here so you need to go back to the front." I said I was just waiting for the employee who was getting sand for me, it was awkward. I get the sand, and the bags are placed at the front of the bottom of the cart and behind them are huggies diapers. Not that this is really relevant, but I usually get pampers so I'm used to a bright blue box under the cart. While I was checking out and scanning the sand, I guess I saw the top of the red box and thought it was the rest of the red bag of sand, or my eyes just completely overlooked the box altogether, but I missed scanning it. The associates at self checkout are staring at me and my son as we walk away and I'm thinking this whole experience is so weird and tense for no reason.... as I'm leaving, I notice my son has gotten ahold of my iced coffee and dumped it all over the front of his cart cover so I stop into the subway in the front for 1,000 napkins. While I'm cleaning him up, I notice one of the associates from the other side walk over to the greeter and say something before they both look over at me. I'm embarrassed already because I think they're going to ask me to clean the floor or something and approach the greeter, who promptly and sternly says "I need to see your receipt." I'm stunned and say oh sure and dig through my purse. I give it to her and she says "I don't see your huggies on here." I was confused for a second because I normally don't get huggies anyways and then quickly remembered I did this trip and THEN instantly realized what was going on and that I had forgotten to scan or pay for them! I could feel my face go so hot and get bright red from embarrassment because I've never been in this situation before and I know what these associates are thinking. I apologized profusely and said I forgot to which she sarcastically said "sure" and pointed to the registers. I of course returned to the register and paid for the diapers before leaving, but I can't help but feel mortified and like I can never go back. It was a mistake but I know that the associates think I was trying to intentionally steal diapers and I feel so awkward about being seen by them there again. I'm confused why the associates who were staring at me didn't mention something or say something like "ma'am did you scan your diapers?" Or "check the bottom of your cart please" or something instead of just walking to the greeter to "catch" me..... I'm worried that I'll be followed around or treated like a criminal everytime I'm in there now. If this happened to you, would you swallow your pride and keep returning (because it is my cheapest and closest store), or would you find a new store/ go to a different location?

title: “Too busy”, or just an option?
self_text: My boyfriend use to make me feel like the only girl in the world. He was never “too busy” to send a simple text throughout the day, let me know he loved me, kiss me, just little things to show he cared. If there was an issue, he was right there to help me figure it out so we can move on from it.   As of about 2 months ago, this all stopped. He barely contacts me through the day. Doesn’t compliment me anymore. Barely tells me he loves me. Doesn’t show affection towards me. There’s nothing. I have conversed about how a little bit of effort or attention would be nice, just a 2 second text, a kiss before bed. Something. But his excuse is that he’s “too busy”. One time he even “forgot” to text me back, but he was consistently active on Snapchat insta fb.   While I have respected that he may actually be busy, it’s kind of hard to believe when throughout the day he is constantly active on social media. I’ve also noticed some nude Instagram women that he Newly follows constantly. You’re too busy to give me any effort back, or even text me one time throughout the day but you are active on social media 24/7? It just doesn’t sit right with me.   I take care of the house as much as possible. Between his son having sports and his work, I do my duties to ensure things get done. Make dinner every night, laundry, cleaning, etc. I keep his son home with me if I’m home so he does not have to take him to work with him. The other morning he told me his son had practice, I told him to drop his son off at home so he didn’t have to take him to work with him. I got his son all ready for practice so it was something he didn’t have to worry about. I told him “___ is ready for practice”, he replied “he isn’t going”. A little communication would have been nice. at this point I keep asking myself what I’m getting out of this relationship besides an excuse of being too busy.   Example: yesterday he did not contact me at all, but was active on social media constantly. Saw that he followed new nude girl accounts. He texted me about 3 pm saying, “hey, going to dinner with tony tonight.”.. like no , do we have plans? Is that cool?… I don’t mind him going to dinner, but when I’m constantly told he is too busy for me but can make dinner plans and do all this other stuff shows me he won’t even take 2 seconds out of his day to make me feel like he’s thinking of me.   I am unsure how to feel, if I’m overthinking, or if my feelings are valid. I feel like I’m an option anymore in his world and that my feelings do not matter. A little advice would be helpful, thank you in advance.

Before we started dating he and lets call her K(25) had been seing eachother for +/- a year. The only reason they didn't officially date is because K has been engaged to somebody else. (K and her fiancee have been dating 5 years now, engaged for 1 year)  They have told eachother they loved them, saw eachother frequently, touched eachother alot and both of them said they haven't kissed. But me and many others have been doubting about that lol.  When he and I started dating he is aaallll over me, he tells me everyday how much he loves me and how I am the one for him. Goodmorning, goodnights, healthy problemsolving w fights etcetc. The usual healthy(maybe a bit clingy) relationship things.   The "breakup" between K and him was messy af(they never dated officially ofc) since he broke it off very abruptly(to date me) and she had been visiting his house crying, going to the bar she knew he was there to talk it out etc. She texted him for a while after that. I told him if he doesn't put her back in her lane and ignore her, I would break up since I'm not for this dating double women shit. So he stopped and told her off.  But... At parties they still talk friendly, take shots together and "bully" eachother. He tells me not to worry but I just can't shake this gut feeling off. I never join at parties since they're not really for me, and I dont wanna start joining him just to "control" the situation.   But there are all these questions in my head like "what if???". Hes been very good to me these past months so I dont wanna take harsh actions or rapid decisions. He know my insecurity and tells me he could never officially date K since she's flirting with alot of guys while going out and hiding her engagement ring etcetc.  Please help me put my thoughts into perspective because I feel like losing it. Maybe I'm overly insecure, thinking too much of it or I'm just batshit crazy.  Thanks for the read!  +++ We're not going to talk about K and her fiancee's situation, whatever they do is their decision, I doubt he doesn't know about K being practically everybody's gf :)+++

title: Pregnancy hormones or reasonable reaction?
self_text: My FIL came to visit from out of town for the weekend. He was looking after my 1 year old while I was cleaning the kitchen. I looked over and saw him giving her sips from his coffee mug. I snapped, "that better not be coffee you're giving her!"  He just laughed at me and said, "it's only a little bit!" I told him not to give my daughter coffee and he just laughed again and started telling my daughter, "your mom is no fun!" (but he did stop giving her the drink).  He does this sort of thing all the time and the coffee incident is a relatively mild example, imo, but I can't help but still feel really mad over the whole thing. However, I'm also pregnant so I'm wondering if I'm overreacting or if this is worth bringing up with my husband?  ETA: apologies for posting in the incorrect area! I never heard of the other sub before. Regardless, I'm just going to let it go. Thanks!

title: AITA for leaving my brother do his own US visa paperwork despite he not knowing English?
self_text: AITA For letting my younger brother do his own US visa paperwork, despite he not knowing English?  I'm a F 36, my brother is 33. During this year my brother has been asking my credit card to buy his stuff (iPhone, iPad, games, collectibles, etc) since he messed up his credit and now he had no cards on his own. He always pays on time and we never had an issue, recently I've noticed he was spending way more than usual, pretty much using all his source of income. He manages a laundry mat and he spends all the earnings. I got worried and called mom, she got angry and asked me not to lend it again no matter what, he still owes her a lot. So the last time he asked me for the card I refused, he went straight to mom and asked for hers. She refused too, but she told him to stop spending that much and pretty much an earful.  My brother called me afterwards and got pissy, saying that I shouldn't have tattletale and other mean things. After that he pretty much stopped talking to me and refused to receive my packages (I work all day and in my country some packages need a signature).  So today out of the blue he wrote me about my status on my visa, we both renewed at the same time 10 years ago, and I told him that I haven't checked on it yet. Which is a lie, since this Saturday I plan to schedule my appointment. I plan on letting him do it on his own, so the question is. AITA?  TL;DR My brother gets angry because I told mother that he had been spending too much. He stops talking to me and is being a jerk, until he needs me for the paperwork of his VISA
